segment.source: This topic explains how to deploy the MBAM Client to end users’ computers.
segment.target: This topic explains how to deploy the MBAM Client to end users’ computers.

segment.source: You can deploy the MBAM Client through an electronic software distribution system, such as Active Directory Domain Services or Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: You can deploy the MBAM Client through an electronic software distribution system, such as Active Directory Domain Services or Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: To deploy the MBAM Client as part of a Windows deployment, see How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment.
segment.target: To deploy the MBAM Client as part of a Windows deployment, see How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment.

segment.source: Before you start the MBAM Client deployment, review the MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: Before you start the MBAM Client deployment, review the MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: To deploy the MBAM Client to desktop or laptop computers
segment.target: To deploy the MBAM Client to desktop or laptop computers

segment.source: Locate the MBAM Client installation files that are provided with the MBAM software.
segment.target: Locate the MBAM Client installation files that are provided with the MBAM software.

segment.source: Use Active Directory Domain Services or an enterprise software deployment tool like Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager to deploy the Windows Installer package to target computers.
segment.target: Use Active Directory Domain Services or an enterprise software deployment tool like Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager to deploy the Windows Installer package to target computers.

segment.source: Configure the distribution settings or Group Policy settings to run the MBAM Client installation file.
segment.target: Configure the distribution settings or Group Policy settings to run the MBAM Client installation file.

segment.source: After successful installation, the MBAM Client applies the Group Policy settings that are received from a domain controller to begin BitLocker Drive Encryption and management functions.
segment.target: After successful installation, the MBAM Client applies the Group Policy settings that are received from a domain controller to begin BitLocker Drive Encryption and management functions.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The MBAM Client does not start BitLocker Drive Encryption actions if a remote desktop protocol connection is active.
segment.target: The MBAM Client does not start BitLocker Drive Encryption actions if a remote desktop protocol connection is active.

segment.source: All remote console connections must be closed and a user must be logged on to a physical console session before BitLocker Drive Encryption begins.
segment.target: All remote console connections must be closed and a user must be logged on to a physical console session before BitLocker Drive Encryption begins.
